review: Well, maybe only regret I have is not purchasing the Roku sooner.  I watch movies every night and cannot think of a more cost effective way to do so.  By minimizing my contribution to my local cable company, I am able to spend more money on my family while saving more at the same time.Keep it plugged into a wall outlet as opposed to plugging into the TVs USB input so that there is not boot time and the Roku is ready to watch as soon as you turn on the TV.  Otherwise, with it plugged into the USB port of the TV, you need to wait 3-4 minutes each time you turn on the TV for the Roku to boot up.  It consumes very little power so leaving it plugged into the wall should not be noticeable on the power bill.The free channels need a little better content and quality but overall it's a great investment.

review: I bought this unit so I could stop using my BluRay player as my "smart TV".My player would lag terribly and I wasn't sure if it was my internet connection or not. After buying this, it was clearly the BluRay player that was not meant to stream movies. I've experienced no lag or connection drops at all!! AND I love using the iPhone app! I use that because the keyboard is easier to type with than the remote control. So much easier typing passwords or searching for movies/actors.

review: With a $50 Roku Stick you no longer need cable.  Full 1080p HDTV resolution, support for separate Netflix profiles and lots of free channels with programs from cable stations.  Supports Amazon Prime Streaming Video, unlike Chromecast.
